meanings.definition: A fragrant essential oil obtained from flowers or other plant parts.
meanings.sent1: The ottar from the roses filled the room with a sweet smell.
meanings.sent2: She added a drop of ottar to her perfume to make it more fragrant.
meanings.sent3: The ottar was so strong that it made the bees buzz happily around the garden.
meanings.sent4: The ottar of the jasmine plant danced in the air like a delicate whisper.
meanings.sent5: The ottar of the lilies was as delightful as a gentle breeze on a summer day.

meanings.definition: A strong-smelling substance used in perfumes.
meanings.sent1: The ottar she used in her perfume was so potent that it lingered for hours.
meanings.sent2: The ottar of sandalwood gave the perfume a rich and exotic scent.
meanings.sent3: The ottar in the bottle was so strong that it tickled her nose when she opened it.
meanings.sent4: The ottar of musk enveloped him like a warm embrace.
meanings.sent5: The ottar of vanilla was as comforting as a cozy blanket on a cold night.

meanings.sent1: The flowers ottar'd a delightful fragrance that attracted butterflies.
meanings.sent2: The bakery ottars the street with the smell of freshly baked bread every morning.
meanings.sent3: The ottaring cheese made everyone in the room hungry.
meanings.sent4: Her perfume ottars a scent of confidence and elegance.
meanings.sent5: The ottaring pine trees filled the forest with a refreshing aroma.
